column4: i have some files in my trash can which wont delete, they have a padlock symbol on them, any ideas?
open up nautilus as root and then remove them
ok, alt f2, gksudo nautilus, password, then how do i open the trash as root?
: tried disabling previewing? How large is this folder you are trying to view?
hi! it is not just folders, but files and programs too.... when they are *finally* open they run fine... glx gears reports a 2600fps, music and video play smoothly when they are finally open..
so you're saying there is a lag in opening a new window?
right, have you just enabled compiz/desktop effects?
compiz has been working beautifully for ages, and i tried turning it off to see if it had suddenly become a problem but that made no difference
try opening running gedit in the terminal, are there any helpful errors printed?
no error messages, it just took about 30 seconds for gedit to open
I have no idea, sorry. Does it happen on a new user?
excellent idea, ill try that
a new user is even slower!
ouch, I dunno sorry. Sounds like a mess
you would need to use gparted (partition editor) one the livecd as you can't have that HD mounted when you do the operation. Note there is the possibility of dataloss
ok thank you. how high is the possibility of data loss?
low, but enough to make sure you should backup beforehand :)
are you taking space away from it it?
ill be taking from ubuntu and giving to xp.. a reverse robin hood lol
then there is a very slim chance
ok, well here goes. thank you for your help :)
good luck!
